chapter.title: File and File System Functions
chapter.para: This chapter covers the available file and file system functions.

section.title: SysAccess
section.para: Checks to see if the user has access permissions on a file.
This function uses the access() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/file name to check access permissions.
The access permissions to check on the file. Must be a decimal number.

section.para: Returns zero on success (all access rights available) or -1 on an error.

example.title: SysGetAccess
example.programlisting:
/* do others have write permission on the file? */
retc = SysAccess("/home/dashley/temp.txt", 2)

section.title: SysChmod
section.para: Sets the mode bits of a file.
This function uses the chmod() C API to perform the action.
You must be the owner of the file or root in order for this function to be successful.

listitem.para: The path/file name to to modify the mode bits.
The new and complete list of bits. Note that it is not possible to unset bits with this function except through this argument. This parameter must be a decimal number.

section.para: Returns zero on success (all access rights available) or -1 on an error.

example.title: SysChmod

section.title: SysChown
section.para: Change the user and group ownership attributes of a file.
This function uses the chown() C API to perform the action.
You must be the owner of the file or root in order for this function to be successful.

listitem.para: The path/filename of the source file to change.
The new numerical user id.
The new numerical group id.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysChown
example.programlisting:
/* change the ownership attributes of a file */
call SysChown "/home/username/myfile", 501, 530

section.title: SysChroot
section.para: Change the root directory of the current process.
This function uses the chroot() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The new root subdirectory base path.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysChroot
example.programlisting:
/* change the ownership attributes of a file */
call SysChroot "/home/username/"

section.title: SysClose
section.para: Close the specified file handle.
This function uses the close() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The file handle to be closed.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

section.title: SysEuidaccess (not available on all systems)
section.para: Checks to see if the effective user has access permissions on a file.
This function uses the euidaccess() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/file name to check access permissions.
The access permissions to check on the file. Must be a decimal number.

section.para: Returns zero on success (all access rights available) or -1 on an error.

example.title: SysEuidaccess
example.programlisting:
/* do others have write permission on the file? */
retc = SysEuidaccess("/home/dashley/temp.txt", 2)

section.title: SysGetdirlist
section.para: Returns an ooRexx array of the file/directory name(s) contained in a subdirectory.

The returned array will contain ALL file and subdirectory names including files usually not displayed (hidden files/directories). The ooRexx array list of files is NOT sorted. The array will be empty if an error occurs opening the subdirectory.
This function uses the opendir(), closedir() and readdir() C APIs to perform the action.

listitem.para: The subdirectory to be listed.

section.para: Returns an ooRexx array.

example.title: SysGetdirlist
example.programlisting:
/* get the subdirectory entries */
arr = SysGetdirlist("./") do entry over arr say entry end

section.title: SysLchown
section.para: Change the user and group ownership attributes of a symbolic link.
This function uses the lchown() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/filename of the source file to change.
The new numerical user id.
The new numerical group id.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysLchown
example.programlisting:
/* change the ownership attributes of a symbolic link */
call SysLchown "/home/username/myfile", 501, 530

section.title: SysLink
section.para: Create a symbolic (hard) link.
This function uses the link() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/filename of the source file.
The new path/filname that will become the hard link.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysLink
example.programlisting:
/* create a new link */
call SysLink "/pub", "/home/username/myownpublink"

section.title: SysMkdirUnix

note.para: This function has been renamed from SysMkdir to SysMkdirUnix due to a name collision with the rexxutil function SysMkDir.

section.para: Create a subdirectory.
This function uses the mkdir() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The new subdirectory name.
The mode (decimal number) for the new subdirectory.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysMkdir
example.programlisting:
/* create a new subdir */
retc = SysMkdirUnix("./pub", b2d("111111101"))

section.title: SysRmdirUnix

note.para: This function has been renamed from SysRmdir to SysRmdirUnix due to a name collision with the rexxutil function SysRmDir.

section.para: Remove a subdirectory.
This function uses the rmdir() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The subdirectory to remove.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

section.title: SysStat
section.para: Returns information about a file.
This function uses the stat64() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/file name.

An option specifying the information to return. The values are all case insensitive and only the first letter of the option value is checked. Allowed values are:
"DEVICE"
The file's owning device id.
"INODE"
The inode number.
"PERMISSIONS"
The permissions in a 10 character string similar to that produced by the shell command "ls -l".
"NUMBERLINKS"
The number of links to the file.
"UID"
The file's owner numerical user id.
"GID"
The file's numerical group id.
"REALDEV"
The file's real device id (if any).
"SIZE"
The file's size in bytes.
"ACCESS"
The file's last access timestamp in the form YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.
"MODIFIED"
The file's last modified timestamp in the form YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.
"CHANGED"
The file's last changed timestamp in the form YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.

section.para: Returns information specified by the option.

example.title: SysStat
example.programlisting:
/* the following examples came from a Linux laptop running Fedora 12 */
SysStat("/home/dashley/temp.txt", "n") --> 1 SysStat("/home/dashley/temp.txt", "u") --> 500 SysStat("/home/dashley/temp.txt", "g") --> 500 SysStat("/home/dashley/temp.txt", "s") --> 427 SysStat("/home/dashley/temp.txt", "a") --> 2009-12-02 13:22:16

section.title: SysSymlink
section.para: Create a symbolic (soft) link.
This function uses the symlink() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/filename of the source file.
The new path/filname that will become the soft link.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

example.title: SysSymlink
example.programlisting:
/* create a new symlink */
call SysSymlink "/pub", "/home/username/myownpublink"

section.title: SysUmask
section.para: Set the umask.
This function uses the umask() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The new umask. This MUST be a decimal number (not octal).

section.para: Returns zero on success or -1 on an error.

section.title: SysUname
section.para: Returns system information.
This function uses the uname() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para:
An option specifying the information to return. The values are all case insensitive and only the first letter of the option value is checked. Allowed values are:
"SYSTEM"
The system name. This is the default option if none is specified.
"NODE"
The system node (or default host) name.
"RELEASE"
The system release name.
"VERSION"
The system version.
"MACHINE"
The system machine type.

section.para: Returns information specified by the option.

example.title: SysUname
example.programlisting:
/* the following examples came from a Linux laptop running Fedora 12 */
SysUname() --> Linux SysUname("s") --> Linux SysUname("n") --> bugs.ibm.com SysUname("r") --> 2.6.31.6-166.fc12.i686 SysUname("v") --> #1 SMP Wed Dec 9 11:14:59 EST 2009 SysUname("m") --> i686

section.title: SysUnLink
section.para: Removes a hard link.
This function uses the unlink() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The path/filename of the source file to be removed.

section.para: Returns zero on success and -1 on an error.

section.title: SysWordexp
section.para: Performs a shell-like expansion of the input expression and returns the result in an array. This function will expand the characters "*", "?" and "~" (the tilde).
This function uses the wordexp() C API to perform the action.

listitem.para: The expression to expand.

section.para: Returns an array of the expanded results.

example.title: SysWordexp
example.programlisting:
/* process an expansion */
arr = SysWordexp("./*.txt" do mem over arr say mem end
